thread.title: Austin Peay baseball through the years
thread.title_full: Austin Peay baseball through the years

title: Austin Peay baseball through the years
persons: Robert Smith/The Leaf-Chronicle Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay
text: Activate your digital access. Austin Peay baseball through the years The baseball program at Austin Peay began in 1931, back when APSU was still the Austin Peay Normal School. Outside of a seven year break for World War I and the 1952 season, the Governors have fielded a team every year since. APSU Digital Archives Terry Holder slides towards third base during the 1969 season. Austin Peay went 7-12 overall and 1-9 for OVC play, in the final year of the Leon Sandifer's leadership of the program. Austin Peay Digital Archives Coach Tom Walding was able to boost the Govs into more ambitious scheduling in his first year that paid off in 1971 when the Governors secured their first Ohio Valley Conference championship title. APSU Digital Archives Ed Inman earned the OVC Pitcher of the Year honor in 1971. APSU Sports Information Nate Manning became the second Austin Peay player to earn conference pitcher of the year in 1986. APSU Sports Information In 1996, Austin Peay earned its first bid into the NCAA baseball Regional play-offs. APSU Sports Information Craig Smith was named the Ohio Valley Conference Pitcher of the Year in 1996. APSU Sports Information The 2005 squad was able to secure the OVC tournament title and trip to the NCAA Knoxville Regional, where the Governors fell to Tennessee and Wichita State. APSU Sports Information Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay players Travis Beech, left, Jacob Shroeder, Adam Muston and winning pitcher Jeff Mault celebrate afer winning the OVC regular-season championship after beating Tennessee Tech 10-5 in 10 innings. Robert Smith/The Leaf-Chronicle Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay's head coach Gary McClure talks with the team after an 11-5 loss to Vanderbilt during the fifth game of the NCAA regional game in Nashville in June 2007. Robert Smith/The Leaf-Chronicle, The Leaf-Chronicle Buy Photo Georgia Tech's Evan Martin steals second as he collides with Austin Peay shortstop Reed Harper during an NCAA regional baseball game against Georgia Tech on June 3, 2011. Harper attended Clarksville High School. John Bazemore / AP Austin Peay baseball team members celebrate winning the 2012 OVC tournament and earning the conference's bid to the NCAA Regional. APSU Sports Information Michael Blanchard makes a reaching catch that robbed Indiana State a run in the 2012 regionals. Eric Evans Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay's head coach Gary McClure holds balloons celebrating his 600th win and the OVC Championship against Jacksonville State in May 2007. Robert Smith/The Leaf-Chronicle, The Leaf-Chronicle Fullscreen Buy Photo Gary McClure is inducted into the 2013 Class of the Austin Peay Hall of Fame in February 2013. THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH, THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay's Gary McClure receives congratulations from his wife, Amy, after winning his 777th game to become the OVC's winningest baseball coach. The April 2013 game was against Tennessee Tech. THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH, THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay's Gary McClure receives congratulations from Austin Peay's P.J. Torres (19) after The Govs beat Tennessee Tech for McClure's 777th win in April 2013. THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH, THE LEAF-CHRONICLE/ROBERT SMITH Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Austin Peay players Brett Luther, left, Dane Miller and Shawn Kelly dump a cooler of ice water on head coach Gary McClure he won the OVC Championship in April 2013 Robert Smith, Robert Smith/The Leaf-Chronicle Buy Photo Michael Davis, center, celebrates his game-winning, three-run home run in the eighth inning of an NCAA college baseball tournament regional game Friday, May 31, 2013, in Bloomington, Ind. Austin Peay defeated Florida 4-3. Doug McSchooler, AP Fullscreen Buy Photo Former Jacksonville State baseball assistant coach Travis Janssen was announced as the 11th coach for Austin Peay baseball on Wednesday, Sept. 16. Autumn Allison/The Leaf-Chronicle Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
